body_html:
There's no need to be so complicated to compile tensorflow via bazel.
I've just compiled it successfully.

Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package
INFO: Elapsed time: 591.058s, Critical Path: 552.93s

Just use the bazel compiled from its HEAD instead of the released 0.2 version, and the command I use to compile tensorflow pip package is as follows:

HTTPS_PROXY=http://proxyip:proxyport ../bazel/output/bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Use bazel compiled from HEAD!

body:
There's no need to be so complicated to compile tensorflow via bazel.
I've just compiled it successfully.

```
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package
INFO: Elapsed time: 591.058s, Critical Path: 552.93s
```

Just use the bazel compiled from its HEAD instead of the released 0.2 version, and the command I use to compile tensorflow pip package is as follows:

```
HTTPS_PROXY=http://proxyip:proxyport ../bazel/output/bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
```

Use bazel compiled from HEAD!
